title: Commander Keen: A New Dope (my Keen 3 mod) released!
content:
I finally got my third Keen mod done, and here it is:
[url=http://www.keengrid.net/ckfiles/modifications/anewdope.zip]www.keengrid.net/ckfiles/...ewdope.zip[/url]

Have fun! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img] (I know you won't, even if the levels are easy this time.)

The alternative K:M topic can be found here:
[url=http://www.keenmodding.org/viewtopic.php?p=10391]www.keenmodding.org/viewt...hp?p=10391[/url]3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: the newest dope here
content: This mod is fun [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]  The first mod I'll really try to play through, and that is something knowing me [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]  The graphics are candy like (the colors) and the level seems fun too. It's not your fault that I die at every single step [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]  That slug at the second level seems to be on lsd or something, but it's strangeness fits the mod well! Craziness at it's best!

title: Re: the newest dope here
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]even if the levels are easy this time[hr][/quote]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

[hr]

Great mod [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] , I quite like the graphics (and the puzzles!) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] great storyline, I loved the 'new dope' title!

I'll post more when I get further through the game..

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Commander Keen: A New Dope (my Keen 3 mod) released!
content:
Oh my goodness - I was laughing so much at the "hints" in the first level that I fell down that green thing and died straight away [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] I guess now people can't say they don't know which things are dangerous in your mods [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

And is that picture of you accurate??? (on the "I am dead" menu item?)

title: Re: Commander Keen: A New Dope (my Keen 3 mod) released!
content: What version of DOSBox are you using?  The .olz extension is correct (it's the original file before it was decompressed, you can delete it.)  Are you running "play.bat" to load the game?

title: Re: Commander Keen: A New Dope (my Keen 3 mod) released!
content:
Awesome mod! The story is really cool and it connects to the game play pretty well I think. I love the Brain-o-Juicer [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] . I really like the way you use the colors in the tiles too, its very appealing to the eye.

I really like how you patched the Vorticon Mother into that Snail; it is the most annoyingly awesome character [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

The bad thing about your mod is that the levels are soooooo hard! I've managed to beat many of them, but some of those jumping puzzles are incredibly hard, especially when they occur towards the end of the level. I realize Keen isn't playing with a full I.Q. but this is driving me crazy [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-deadkeenvort.gif[/img]

All in all, great mod, I'm gonna keep trying to beat this without cheating (found the "keenrush cheat" on accident [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img] )
KeenRush, I seriously can't believe how small your tileset is... this mod blows my mind. I've been struggling to get something HALF this cool for my mod. You're incredible.

title: Re: !!
content:
I guessed the KeenRush cheat pretty early on, because I'm so bad at jumping puzzles (especially in Keen1-3 with the movement lag) I still can't get past the first level [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shucks.gif[/img]

I don't know why everyone disables flying in God mode (that's the whole point of a *cheat*) so I'm going to have to tweak the patch to enable flying again just so I can see further than the first level [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

title: hehe
content: Don't feel bad, Malv; I had to turn flying back on, too.

Yes, I am, and I'm running DOSbox 1.65, but the version doesn't matter at all because all other mods I played so far do work, and it crashes in XP too (where other mods would normally either play correctly or show a black screen). This one just gives me a memory error.

I'll redownload it later and try again.____________

title: Re: hehe
content:
Only reason I can think of is that your Keen 3 is not version 1.31. Everything should work.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

And if you really have the right version, try installing the mod again on a fresh Keen 3, just unlzexe your exe and then run play.bat.


Glad you guys like the small tileset. Also, the first level shouldn't be that difficult! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: hehe
content:
If you disable the flying cheat, then you'll stop people from being able to have a good look at your mod - so don't then complain about getting hardly any responses to your work [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

To find out which version of Keen you're running, do this:
[pre] G:\Keen3>keen3 > ver.txt<Keen loads, quit Keen>G:\Keen3>type ver.txtLoading Commander Keen part 3... (version 1.31 1/23/90)Joystick not detectedVGA card detected[/pre]
I'm using DOSBox 0.65 and it works fine for me.

title: Ugh!
content:
What is it with you foriegn people and credit cards?

Credit is not bad; unless you are intending to buy your house, car, and college on good looks (Or government subsidies) then I suggest you take another look at credit cards. It's about responsibility; if you have the responsibility of a gerbil then credit cards are not the problem --you are.

I had some jackass trying to convince me to use buy something on E-bay for him because he was too afraid to get a credit card; people, it's not like they are magically going to zap you of maturity. The lack of maturity is either there before you get the card or not, the card is mutually exclusive to that problem. You pay when you are supposed to every month, and no problems arise.

I know that's a terribly amazing concept...

title: Re: Ugh!
content:
Actually, I'm very good with money, but I have no NEED for a credit card, and getting one costs money. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Ugh!
content:
Not necessarily - I have a Visa debit card, and it works just like a credit card (in that I can buy stuff online from overseas in a foreign currency, just by putting in the Visa card number) but unlike a credit card there are no fees, no interest, and I can only spend whatever I have in my bank account at the time, just like a normal debit card. I didn't even have to pay anything to get one!

I've had it for nearly five years now, and it works a treat. Most banks here seem to offer them, if you go looking for it on their websites.

title: Bah!
content: Assuming, of course, you backed up those floppies to a CD or something--because every single old game's original disk that I own has gone bad. Stick it in the drive, access A:\, get a lot of grinding and buzzing before Windows says "lol, no format. Now what, sucker?"

title: Re: Bah!
content:
Use an old 386/windows 3.1 system, they don't check the FAT header so strictly and will often run the disk, then just copy to a fesh disk.

Works for all my stuff![img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Bah!
content:
Did you know that I had a computer which destroyed every floppy disk's 0th sector, thus disabling the operating system from recognizing the file system of the disk, and formatting it? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] ------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Bah!
content:
You know there are data recovery applications, which just check the actual disk data and skipping the damaged file system, trying to determine the file system itself? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-potter.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Bah!
content:
Well, I THINK there are. At least I know there are plenty of file recovery apps out there, and if they're doing it well they'll try to get around the FS thing. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________

title: Re: Bah!
content:
The 0th sector should contain bytes with the following info:
- Bootsector OS loader stub (contains a jump and a signature... also a couple of error messages)
- File system type indicator
- Pointer to FAT in FAT/FAT32 file systems
- Something more.

Most recovery apps are propietary, and not freeware.------------------------------
